generif.text: Mutations in GKRP are found in the French population, but they do not account for the linkage between the 2p23 locus and quantitative markers of obesity.

The alteration in glucokinase (GK) activity caused by polymorphic activating mutations may have a more profound biological impact than the alleviation of inhibition caused by interaction with GKRP.
Different type 2 doabetes mutations impair glucokinase function through different mechanisms such as enzymatic activity, protein stability and increased interaction with the flucokinase receptor
Deletions are detected in exons are investigated in maturity-onset diabetes of the young.

GCKR gene variants inversely associated with serum triglycerides/fasting plasma glucose levels in type 2 diabetes and metabolic syndrome. Suggest cardiovascular risk role of GCKR minor allele carriage based on carotid intima-media thickness association.
glucokinase regulator is a susceptibility gene in Japanese families with clustered diabetes
Data show that a novel polymorphism (rs4425043) in the GCKR gene increases the risk of overweight and obesity in Chinese women.
Findings are compatible with the idea that GCKR variability may play a pathogenetic role in both type 2 diabetes and CKD.
pharmacological manipulation of GCK activity at locations distal from the allosteric activator site is possible.
Our findings confirm the inverse modulating effect of functional GCKR variants on triglycerides and glucose levels in obese paediatric patients and healthy normal-weight controls.
The rs3817588 A/G polymorphism of the glucokinase regulatory protein gene was associated with type 2 diabetes and plasma triglyceride level in the Han Chinese population.

Evidence for the existence of rare APOA5 and GCKR haplotypes in metabolic syndrome patients with higher triglyceride levels, which contribute to the complex lipid metabolism alteration in this disease.
a significant interaction between the GCKR rs1260326-P446L polymorphism and plasma n-3 PUFA levels modulating insulin resistance and inflammatory markers in metabolic syndrome
The role of four loci (ADCY5, GIPR, GCKR and VPS13C) in early impairment of glucose and insulin metabolism in children, was investigated.
Study provides evidence that GCKR rs780094, a single-nucleotide polymorphism related to diabetes, may be associated with pancreatic cancer risk.
Data suggest that GCKR P446L variant (an SNP [rs1260326] associated with type 2 diabetes risk) alters ability of GCKR to sequester glucokinase in nucleus of hepatocytes.
The rs1260326 in GCKR is associated with hepatic fat accumulation along with large VLDL and triglyceride levels. GCKR and PNPLA3 act together to convey susceptibility to fatty liver in obese youths.

Defects were observed for the majority of rare variants after assessment of cellular localization, ability to interact with GCK, and kinetic activity of the encoded proteins. Functional rare variants showed associations with lipid phenotypes.

2 SNPs, rs780093 and rs780094, located in intronic regions of the GCKR gene were found to be significantly associated with the development of gout in male Han Chinese; GCKR was identified as a novel candidate gene associated with gout
Essential roles of the polymorphisms of the APOA5, GCK and GCKR in the lipid or glucose metabolism disorders.
Only one single nucleotide polymorphism of GCKR hyperglycemia was significantly associated with amino acid blood levels, hyperglycemia, and risk for type 2 diabetes.

genetic association study in population in Spain: Data suggest that one SNP in GCKR (rs1260326; not rs1799884) is significantly associated with hypertriglyceridemia; risk of cardiovascular disease can be modulated by adherence to Mediterranean diet.

no detectable effect (with an OR >2.1) of the variants in GCKR, GIPR, ADCY5 and VPS13C on the response to sulfonylurea treatment, indicating that these variants are not significantly contributing to the risk of SH in patients with T2D
This meta-analysis suggests that the rs780094 polymorphism in GCKR is associated with elevated type 2 diabetes risk.
Triglycerides-increasing alleles of GCKR variants reduce insulin and HOMA-IR index, and protect from insulin resistance in Chinese children.

Some, but not all, associations between variants in NCAN, lysophospholipase-like 1, GCKR, and PPP1R3B with hepatic steatosis (with and without increased ALT level) were significant within subpopulations.

RESULTS: rs1260326 in GCKR (beta=1.30, P = 3.23E-03), rs17319721 in SHROOM3 (beta = -1.28, P-value = 3.18E-03) and rs12917707 in UMOD (beta = 2.0, P-value = 8.84E-04) were significantly associated with baseline estimated GFR
Crystal structure of glucokinase regulatory protein
We find that GKRP acts as an allosteric switch for GK in blood glucose control by the liver.
GCKR and PNPLA3 genes interact to result in increased susceptibility to NAFLD.
GCKR rs780094 variant confers high cross-ethnicity risk for the development of T2DM, while significant associations between GCK, MTNR1B and G6PC2 variants and T2DM risk are limited to Caucasians.

Findings from middle-aged to older adults confirm associations between rs1260326 GCKR and triglycerides and glucose, suggest gene-environment interactions, but do not provide evidence that its relevance extends to cognitive and physical capability.
Our observations provide a model for the regulation of GCK-GKRP complex stability by sugar phosphates involving a subtle reorganization of the GKRP scaffold.
GCKR rs780094 was associated with TG, HDL-C, and HbA1c levels, as well as with CIMT in Japanese community-dwelling men.
GK and GKRP immunoreactivities are changed in pyramidal neurons and newly expressed in astrocytes in the ischemic CA1 after transient cerebral ischemia
genetic polymorphism is associated with Factor VII and with plasma viscosity
The GCKR rs780093 polymorphism is a risk factor for coronary heart disease in individuals aged 65 and older.

genetic association studies in Han Chinese population in Taiwan: Data suggest that an SNP in GCKR (rs780094) is associated with increased susceptibility/risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in the population of obese children studied.

Data indicate that in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), glucokinase regulatory protein (GCKR) rs780094 C>T is associated with the severity of liver fibrosis and with higher serum triglyceride levels.

Results showed that the GCKR rs1260326 polymorphism is significantly associated with the risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) in Japanese individuals, and found a possible significant interaction between this polymorphism and current smoking on CKD risk.

Data suggest that GK (glucokinase) and GKRP (glucokinase regulatory protein) form stabile complex with co-operative interaction and allosteric regulation of both activities; studies involved isolated recombinant proteins/site-directed mutagenesis.

genetic association studies in Japan: Data suggest that SNPs in GCKR (rs780094), TRIB1 (tribbles pseudokinase 1, rs2954021), and PNPLA3 (patatin-like phospholipase domain containing 3, rs738409) are associated with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.

genetic association studies in population in Norfolk, England: Data suggest that an SNP in GCKR (rs780094) is associated with risk of cardiometabolic diseases (cardiovascular diseases; diabetes type 2) in the population studied.
Despite evidence for their collective functional and clinical relevance, results emphasize the low predictive value of rare GCKR variants in individuals and the complex heritability of lipid traits.

Mutations in the genes glucokinase regulatory protein (GCKR), RNase L (RNASEL), leukocyte immunoglobulin-like receptor 3 (LILRA3), and dynein axonemal heavy chain 10 (DNAH10) segregated with elevated HDLc levels in families, while no mutations associated with low HDLc.
Individuals who are homozygous TT at rs1260326 of the GCKR gene have higher triglyceride, total and LDL cholesterol levels regardless of the presence of GCK mutations.
meta-analysis provides evidence of significant association between GCKR rs780094 and risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease
GCKR rs780094 variants modulate uric acid concentrations in Chinese males.
Single-nucleotide polymorphisms alleles near GCKR that were associated with higher coffee consumption.
The AA genotype in maternal GCKR rs780094 is associated with an increased risk for neural tube defects and spina bifida in the Chinese population.
GCKR variants across the allelic spectrum have effects on glucose and lipid homeostasis. [Review]
Two new polymorphisms associated with gall bladder disease and obesity in women have been identified, GCKR rs1260326, and TTC39B rs686030.
This study shows that in patients with type 2 diabetes who were not selected for liver abnormalities, liver fat content was related to GCKR rs1260326 polymorphism
GCKR rs1260326 gene variant, which is associated with greater glycolysis, increases hepatic De Novo Lipogenesis.
GCKR polymorphisms might be independent predictors of survival in metastatic gastric cancer patients treated with first-line EOF chemotherapy

this is the first evidence that n-3 LC-PUFAs may modulate the impact of the GCKR rs1260326 polymorphism on TG concentrations in adolescents. Several molecular mechanisms, in link with glucose uptake, could explain these findings
rs1260326 in GCKR significantly associates with alpha-1 antitrypsin levels.
SNPs in SORT1, CETP and GCKR were individually associated with lipid level variations in Algerian population.
Polymorphisms in GCKR, SLC17A1 and SLC22A12 were associated with phenotype gout in Han Chinese males.
interaction effects between GCKR genetic variants and the dietary MUFA:SFA ratio on lipid levels
Disruption of the GKRP-glucokinase complex is a promising new antidiabetic target, since it results in lower plasma glucose levels without inducing hypoglycemia[review]
rs1260326 T-allele was associated with plasma lactate in European-Americans and African-Americans.
The GCKR rs780092 variant showed opposite-directional associations with type 2 diabetes and hypertriacylglycerolaemia in a Chinese population.
Lifestyle Intervention for Weight Loss and Cardiometabolic Changes in the Setting of Glucokinase Regulatory Protein Inhibition: Glucokinase Regulatory Protein-Leu446Pro Variant in Look AHEAD

Given that acetylated GKRP may affiliate with type-2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), understanding the mechanism of GKRP acetylation in the liver could reveal novel targets within the GK-GKRP pathway, for treating T2DM and other metabolic pathologies.
The present study explored the association between a common variant of the glucokinase regulator (GCKR) gene and metabolic syndrome and its related traits in Taiwanese adolescents
We found that the PPARGC1A and PNPLA3 variants, but not the GCKR variant, were associated with NASH.

Data suggest that hepatic glucokinase activity is regulated by reversible binding to specific inhibitor protein glucokinase regulatory protein (GKRP) and by binding to activator proteins such as 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase/fructose 2,6-bisphosphatase (PFK2/FBP2); changes in glucokinase expression and activity are associated with poorly controlled type 2 diabetes and nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. [REVIEW]
The AA genotype of the GCKR rs780094 polymorphism may increase the risk of T2D among ethnic Uygurs from Xinjiang.
Carriers of the C allele of rs780094 were 1.41 (odds ratio, 95% CI, 0.97-2.03) times more likely to develop Gestational Diabetes.

The rs780094 [1.34 (1.21-1.49); p = 8.57 x 10(-8) ] on chr 2 at the glucokinase regulatory protein (GCKR) locus was similarly significantly associated, while the rs10911205 [1.29 (1.16-1.44); p = 3.52 x 10(-6) ] on chr1 at the laminin subunit gamma-1 (LAMC1) locus showed suggestive association with disease.

Patients with moderately controlled type 2 diabetes carrying two T alleles displayed higher plasma triglycerides levels than homozygous carriers of the C allele, whereas no differences were observed in healthy individuals.

Among Mexicans, the PNPLA3 (rs738409), LYPLAL1 (rs12137855), PPP1R3B (rs4240624), and GCKR (rs780094) polymorphisms may be associated with a greater risk of chronic liver disease among overweight adults.

Three loci showed robust, replicating association with circulating FXI levels: KNG1 (rs710446, P-value = 2.07 x 10-302), F11 (rs4253417, P-value = 2.86 x 10-193), and a novel association in GCKR (rs780094, P-value = 3.56 x10-09), here for the first time implicated in FXI regulation. The two first SNPs (rs710446 and rs4253417) also associated with partial thromboplastin time

GCKR Leu446 may influence FGF21 expression via its ability to increase glucokinase (GCK) activity. This can lead to enhanced FGF21 expression via elevated fatty acid synthesis, consequent to the inhibition of carnitine/palmitoyl-transferase by malonyl-CoA, and via increased glucose-6-phosphate-mediated activation of the carbohydrate response element binding protein, known to regulate FGF21 gene expression.
GCKR association with adiposity and the risk of the nonalcoholic fatty liver disease
Interaction of any alcohol exposure with GCKR (rs780094) and A1CF (rs10821905) influenced the risk of gout in Europeans

The existence of a liver-specific FOXA2-regulated transcriptional enhancer at an intronic T2D locus represented by rs780094, rs780095, and rs780096 SNPs that increases GCKR expression is demonstrated.
GCKR rs780094-C is associated with increased risk of gestational diabetes mellitus.[meta-analysis]

The risk alleles in PNPLA3, GCKR or TM6SF2 were not found to be individually associated with the presence of a disease risk factor and were not significantly more common in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease of patients with raised serum PIIINP.

the risk alleles showed different metabolic effects: PNPLA3 rs738409-G, the strongest genetic non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) risk factor, did not associate with metabolic changes. Metabolic effects of GCKR rs1260326-T were comparable in many respects to the fatty liver associations

genome-wide association study in US: Data suggest, among white subjects, an SNP in RCN3 (rs34459162) and a missense mutation in GCKR (rs1260236) are associated with serum levels of glycated albumin; among black subjects, an intergenic SNP in PRKCA (rs2438321) is associated with fructosamine levels and an intronic variant in PRKCA (rs59443763) is associated with glycated albumin levels. (RCN3 = reticulocalbin-3)

The results of this population-based study provide evidence for a relationship between lipid regulatory gene polymorphisms including GCKR (rs780094), GCKR (rs1260333), FADS (rs174547), and MLXIPL (rs3812316) with dyslipidemia in an Iranian population.
The results suggest that the GCKR and G6PC2 genes may contribute to the risk of type 2 diabetes independently and/or in an interactive manner in the Han Chinese population.
The GCKR rs780094, SLC30A8 rs13266634 and FTO rs9939609 SNPs were demonstrated to be the potential biomarkers for gestational diabetes risk prediction.
Results show that GCKR was associated with hypertriglyceridemia in Mexican Mestizos but not in Mexican Amerindians.
Studies indicate a significant association between glucokinase regulatory protein (GKRP; GCKR) variants and coronary artery disease (CAD) [Meta-analysis].
Our results suggest that the association of rs780094 with lactate levels may involve differential GCKR expression between the carriers of the C and T alleles.

GCKR SNPs are associated with lipid profiles and glycemic status in the Korean population, and the genetic effect is modified by basal circulating calcium levels, particularly in normal or high ranges.
Our data indicated that in DMF exposure, GCKR rs780094 may contribute to the risk of liver injury.
PNPLA3, GCKR, and TM6SF2 risk alleles may be associated with hepatic fat content in a cohort of Italian children with obesity

Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease was strongly associated with three genetic variants, TM6SF2 rs58542926, PNPLA3 rs738409 and GCKR rs1260326, and more slightly with ELOVL2 rs2236212, in obese children and adolescents.

Excessive gestational weight gain (GWG) was noticed in women that were overweight or obese before pregnancy. Study found a significant association between the variant genotype of GNB3 rs5443 and excessive GWG. Similarly, the presence of variant genotype of PNPLA3 rs738409 in mothers was associated with a lower ponderal index (PI) in their newborns. Study found no associations between GCKR rs780094 and birth weight or PI.
An intronic variant in the GCKR gene is associated with multiple lipids.
A significant association between GCKR rs780094 and the times the individuals performed physical exercise was observed.
Increased expression of GCKR is associated with dyslipidemia.
Association of rs780094 polymorphism of glucokinase regulatory protein with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.
Metabolomic and genetic associations with insulin resistance in pregnancy.
Contribution of Rs780094 and Rs1260326 Polymorphisms in GCKR Gene to Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease: A Meta-Analysis Involving 26,552 Participants.
Association of GCKR Gene Polymorphisms with Metabolic Syndrome in a Han Population from Northeast China.
Association of glucokinase gene and glucokinase regulatory protein gene polymorphisms with gestational diabetes mellitus: A case-control study.
Pleiotropic Effects of Common and Rare GCKR Exonic Mutations on Cardiometabolic Traits.
Additive genetic effect of GCKR, G6PC2, and SLC30A8 variants on fasting glucose levels and risk of type 2 diabetes.
GCKR and GCK polymorphisms are associated with increased risk of end-stage kidney disease in Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes: The Hong Kong Diabetes Register (1995-2019).
Waist circumference mediates the association between rs1260326 in GCKR gene and the odds of lean NAFLD.
GCKR and ADIPOQ gene polymorphisms in women with gestational diabetes mellitus.
Interaction between the GCKR rs1260326 variant and serum HDL cholesterol contributes to HOMA-beta and ISIMatusda in the middle-aged T2D individuals.
Prevalence of GCKR rs1260326 Variant in Subjects with Obesity Associated NAFLD and T2DM: A Case-Control Study in South Punjab, Pakistan.
ChREBP is activated by reductive stress and mediates GCKR-associated metabolic traits.

name: glucokinase regulator

reactome.name: Regulation of Glucokinase by Glucokinase Regulatory Protein
Defective TPR may confer susceptibility towards thyroid papillary carcinoma (TPC)

summary: This gene encodes a protein belonging to the GCKR subfamily of the SIS (Sugar ISomerase) family of proteins. The gene product is a regulatory protein that inhibits glucokinase in liver and pancreatic islet cells by binding non-covalently to form an inactive complex with the enzyme. This gene is considered a susceptibility gene candidate for a form of maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY). [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
